intro: Tuberaria variabilis f. milleri, commonly known as the Milleri's Tuberaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cistaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant is native to the Iberian Peninsula and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
